definition: to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
bored/depressed/melancholy/sealed/airtight/tightly closed
stuffy/shut indoors/to smother/to cover tightly
lit. to eliminate worry and dispel melancholy (idiom); diversion from boredom/to dispel depression or melancholy/to relieve stress/a relaxing pass-time
to divert one's mind from boredom (idiom)
to use it for the purpose of relieving the tedium to some extent

sentences.english: Sewing and watching television are her resorts when she is alone.
sentences.chinese: 她單獨一人的時候常以縫衣看電視來解悶兒。

sentences.english: Bite to plan to buy two books return to seeing at to dissipate sorrows.
sentences.chinese: 咬咬牙打算買兩本書回去看着解悶。

sentences.english: Another great strategy is to help others feel good about themselves.
sentences.chinese: 另一個大好策略是幫人消愁解悶。

sentences.english: That afternoon Juanita dropped in to brighten Carol.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午，朱恩妮塔跑來串門，給卡羅爾解悶。

sentences.english: She reads love stories as an escape.
But the only time I seem to have for fun reading is on airplanes.
sentences.chinese: 不過，只有坐飛機的時候看這些書纔是爲了解悶的。

definition: to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun

bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom

to console
to harangue/loud arrogant talk/to spout
